page.title: 14Birnie Church.
page.content: Birnie Church is about 3km south of Elgin and 1km from the River Lossie. It is the oldest church in continuous use in Scotland. It was built in 1140 on the former site of a 6th century Celtic Church which in turn was established by Brendan the Navigator on a pre_Christian stone circle sanctuary.The church font and the unusual rectangular hand bell are of Celtic origin.The church is on a hill surrounded by trees and farmland.The road to the church is tree_lined.In 1729 the west wall had to be rebuilt and yet it looks the oldest wall of the church.The walls are almost 4 feet thick.The church has 3 stained_glass windows painted by a local artist.It was the first cathedral of Moray.The Minister,Mr Torrie,is its 23rd since The Reformation.
